title: Trump's unchecked imperialism raises growing concerns
subhead: While the Trump administration's handling of the Venezuelan situation has revealed numerous contradictions, its intentions regarding Greenland have sparked anxiety and opposition among members of Congress, including Republicans.

title: Venezuela, under state of emergency, stages illusory transition
Greenland: Europe rejects US threats over sovereignty but finds options limited
In Paris, Ukraine's allies express hopes and fears over US security guarantees
subhead: The coalition of the willing, a group of Kyiv's allies who met in Paris on Tuesday, said they were ready to send troops to Ukraine for a ceasefire if they were guaranteed that the US would deter any new Russian attack.

title: Paris snow forces 140 flight cancellations
subhead: France's transport minister said around 100 flights were canceled at Paris's Charles de Gaulle airport because of snowfall, and a further 40 at the capital's Orly airport, as of Wednesday morning.

title: Brigitte Bardot to be buried in Saint-Tropez as cause of death revealed
subhead: The French actress, who died on December 28, will be buried in the town's seaside cemetery. The religious ceremony began at 11 am. Earlier, her husband revealed she had died from cancer.

title: 'Whoever controls Greenland influences a key area of European security policy'
subhead: In response to US threats to invade the vast Arctic island, the EU must implement close military cooperation with Denmark, supported by Germany and France, argues economist Guntram Wolff.

title: Under Trump, the feats of the US military regularly run into the great void of the 'day after'

Reviving Venezuela's oil industry comes at a steep cost
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhead: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

title: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
subhead: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

title: They cook organic, distrust science and oppose vaccines: America's 'crunchy moms' shift toward Trump
subhead: In the 1960s, the 'crunchy mom' was typically an American hippie trying to stay connected to nature. Today, she claims total freedom over health decisions, sometimes flirting with conspiracy theories.

title: EU-Mercosur deal: France's diplomatic gamble falls short
'Trump seeks to usher the Monroe Doctrine into a third era, that of post-Westernism'
The return of the US's predatory imperialism
